rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TE.STUDYID

datasetVariables.definition: A sequence of characters used by the sponsor to uniquely identify the study.
datasetVariables.label: Study Identifier
datasetVariables.name: STUDYID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TE.DOMAIN

datasetVariables.definition: An abbreviation for a collection of observations, with a topic-specific commonality.
datasetVariables.label: Domain Abbreviation
datasetVariables.name: DOMAIN
datasetVariables.notes: 2-character abbreviation, which must be "TE".

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TE.ETCD

datasetVariables.label: Element Code
datasetVariables.name: ETCD
datasetVariables.notes: ETCD (the companion to ELEMENT) is limited to 8 characters and does not have special character restrictions. These values should be short for ease of use in programming, but it is not expected that ETCD will need to serve as a variable name.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TE.ELEMENT

datasetVariables.label: Description of Element
datasetVariables.name: ELEMENT
datasetVariables.notes: The name of the element.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TE.TESTRL

datasetVariables.label: Rule for Start of Element
datasetVariables.name: TESTRL
datasetVariables.notes: Expresses the rule for beginning the element.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TE.TEENRL

datasetVariables.label: Rule for End of Element
datasetVariables.name: TEENRL
datasetVariables.notes: Expresses the rule for ending the element. Either TEENRL or TEDUR must be present for each element.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TE.TEDUR

datasetVariables.label: Planned Duration of Element
datasetVariables.name: TEDUR
datasetVariables.notes: Used when the rule for ending the element is applied after a fixed duration.

datasets.description: A trial design domain that contains the element code that is unique for each element, the element description, and the rules for starting and ending an element.
datasets.label: Trial Elements
datasets.name: TE

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TA.STUDYID

datasetVariables.definition: A sequence of characters used by the sponsor to uniquely identify the study.
datasetVariables.label: Study Identifier
datasetVariables.name: STUDYID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TA.DOMAIN

datasetVariables.definition: An abbreviation for a collection of observations, with a topic-specific commonality.
datasetVariables.label: Domain Abbreviation
datasetVariables.name: DOMAIN
datasetVariables.notes: 2-character abbreviation, which must be "TA".

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TA.ARMCD

datasetVariables.definition: A short sequence of characters that represents the planned arm to which the subject was assigned.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Arm Code
datasetVariables.name: ARMCD
datasetVariables.notes: ARMCD is limited to 20 characters and does not have special character restrictions.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TA.ARM

datasetVariables.definition: The name of the planned arm to which the subject was assigned.
datasetVariables.label: Description of Planned Arm
datasetVariables.name: ARM

priorVersion.title: Planned Order of Element within Arm

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TA.TAETORD

self.title: Planned Order of Element within Arm

datasetVariables.definition: An assigned numeric identifier that gives the planned order of the element within the trial arm of the study.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
datasetVariables.name: TAETORD

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TA.ETCD

datasetVariables.label: Element Code
datasetVariables.name: ETCD
datasetVariables.notes: ETCD (the companion to ELEMENT) is limited to 8 characters and does not have special character restrictions. These values should be short for ease of use in programming, but it is not expected that ETCD will need to serve as a variable name.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TA.ELEMENT

datasetVariables.label: Description of Element
datasetVariables.name: ELEMENT
datasetVariables.notes: The name of the element.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TA.TABRANCH

datasetVariables.label: Branch
datasetVariables.name: TABRANCH
datasetVariables.notes: Condition subjects meet, at a "branch" in the trial design at the end of this element, to be included in this arm.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TA.TATRANS

datasetVariables.label: Transition Rule
datasetVariables.name: TATRANS
datasetVariables.notes: If the trial design allows a subject to transition to an element other than the next element in sequence, then the conditions for transitioning to those other elements, and the alternative element sequences, are specified in this rule.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TA.EPOCH

datasetVariables.definition: A time period defined in the protocol with a study-specific purpose.
datasetVariables.label: Epoch
datasetVariables.name: EPOCH
datasetVariables.notes: The epoch associated with the value in ELEMENT and the value in ARMCD.

datasets.description: A trial design domain that contains each planned arm in the trial.
datasets.label: Trial Arms
datasets.name: TA

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TX.STUDYID

datasetVariables.definition: A sequence of characters used by the sponsor to uniquely identify the study.
datasetVariables.label: Study Identifier
datasetVariables.name: STUDYID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TX.DOMAIN

datasetVariables.definition: An abbreviation for a collection of observations, with a topic-specific commonality.
datasetVariables.label: Domain Abbreviation
datasetVariables.name: DOMAIN
datasetVariables.notes: 2-character abbreviation, which must be "TX".

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TX.SETCD

datasetVariables.label: Set Code
datasetVariables.name: SETCD
datasetVariables.notes: Short name of a specific trial set, as defined by the sponsor. Maximum 8 characters. This represents the trial set for which parameters are being submitted.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TX.SET

datasetVariables.label: Set Description
datasetVariables.name: SET
datasetVariables.notes: Long description of a specific trial set, as defined by the sponsor.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TX.TXSEQ

datasetVariables.label: Sequence Number
datasetVariables.name: TXSEQ
datasetVariables.notes: Unique number for this record within this dataset.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TX.TXPARMCD

datasetVariables.label: Trial Set Parameter Short Name
datasetVariables.name: TXPARMCD
datasetVariables.notes: Short character value for the trial set parameter described in TXPARM. Maximum 8 characters.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TX.TXPARM

datasetVariables.label: Trial Set Parameter
datasetVariables.name: TXPARM
datasetVariables.notes: Term for the trial set parameter. Maximum 40 characters.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TX.TXVAL

datasetVariables.examples: Fed ad libitum or "Restricted Feeding" when TXPARM is "FEEDREG"
datasetVariables.label: Trial Set Parameter Value
datasetVariables.name: TXVAL
datasetVariables.notes: Value of the trial set parameter. Some parameters may be subject to controlled terminology.

datasets.description: A trial design domain that contains one record for each trial set characteristic including experimental factors, treatment factors, inherent characteristics, or distinct sponsor designations. This domain is not subject oriented.
datasets.label: Trial Sets
datasets.name: TX

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TT.STUDYID

datasetVariables.definition: A sequence of characters used by the sponsor to uniquely identify the study.
datasetVariables.label: Study Identifier
datasetVariables.name: STUDYID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TT.DOMAIN

datasetVariables.definition: A sequence of characters used by the sponsor to uniquely identify the study.
datasetVariables.label: Domain Abbreviation
datasetVariables.name: DOMAIN
datasetVariables.notes: 2-character abbreviation, which must be "TT".

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TT.RSTGCD

datasetVariables.label: Repro Stage Code
datasetVariables.name: RSTGCD
datasetVariables.notes: Short name of the repro stage, used for programming and sorting. Maximum 8 characters.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TT.RSTAGE

datasetVariables.label: Description of Repro Stage
datasetVariables.name: RSTAGE
datasetVariables.notes: The name of the repro stage.

priorVersion.title: Rule for Start of Repro Stage

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TT.TTSTRL

self.title: Rule for Start of Repro Stage

datasetVariables.label: Rule for Start of Repro Stage
datasetVariables.name: TTSTRL
datasetVariables.notes: Expresses the rule for beginning the repro stage.

priorVersion.title: Rule for End of Repro Stage

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TT.TTENRL

self.title: Rule for End of Repro Stage

datasetVariables.label: Rule for End of Repro Stage
datasetVariables.name: TTENRL
datasetVariables.notes: Expresses the rule for ending the repro stage. Either TTENRL or TTDUR must be present for each repro stage.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TT.TTDUR

datasetVariables.label: Planned Duration of Repro Stage
datasetVariables.name: TTDUR
datasetVariables.notes: Used when the rule for ending the repro stage is applied after a fixed duration.

datasets.description: Describes the planned unique reproductive stages in a non-clinical developmental and reproductive toxicology study, with reproductive stage code, description, and rules for start and end.
datasets.label: Trial Repro Stages
datasets.name: TT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TP.STUDYID

datasetVariables.definition: A sequence of characters used by the sponsor to uniquely identify the study.
datasetVariables.label: Study Identifier
datasetVariables.name: STUDYID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TP.DOMAIN

datasetVariables.definition: An abbreviation for a collection of observations, with a topic-specific commonality.
datasetVariables.label: Domain Abbreviation
datasetVariables.name: DOMAIN
datasetVariables.notes: 2-character abbreviation, which must be "TP".

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TP.RPATHCD

datasetVariables.definition: A short sequence of characters that represents the planned reproductive path to which the subject was assigned.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Repro Path Code
datasetVariables.name: RPATHCD
datasetVariables.notes: Limited to 20 characters. Should be populated in Demographics when repro paths have been defined in this domain.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TP.RPATH

datasetVariables.label: Description of Planned Repro Path
datasetVariables.name: RPATH
datasetVariables.notes: Name of the planned repro path.

priorVersion.title: Order of Repro Stage within Repro Path

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TP.TPSTGORD

self.title: Order of Repro Stage within Repro Path

datasetVariables.label: Order of Repro Stage within Repro Path
datasetVariables.name: TPSTGORD
datasetVariables.notes: Number that gives the planned order of the repro stage within the repro path.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TP.RSTGCD

datasetVariables.label: Repro Stage Code
datasetVariables.name: RSTGCD
datasetVariables.notes: Short name of the repro stage used for programming and sorting. Maximum 8 characters. The values of RSTGCD used in the Trial Paths dataset must match values for the same repro stage in the Trial Stages dataset.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TP.RSTAGE

datasetVariables.label: Description of Repro Stage
datasetVariables.name: RSTAGE
datasetVariables.notes: The name of the repro stage.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TP.TPBRANCH

datasetVariables.label: Branch
datasetVariables.name: TPBRANCH
datasetVariables.notes: Conditions subjects meet, occurring at the end of a repro stage, which cause a repro path to branch off from another repro path.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TP.RPHASE

datasetVariables.label: Repro Phase
datasetVariables.name: RPHASE
datasetVariables.notes: Name of the reproductive phase with which this repro stage of the repro path is associated.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TP.RPRFDY

datasetVariables.label: Repro Phase Start Reference Day
datasetVariables.name: RPRFDY
datasetVariables.notes: Sponsor protocol-defined first day of repro phase. Should be zero or 1.

datasets.description: Describes each planned reproductive path in a non-clinical developmental and reproductive toxicology study, with the ordered sequence of reproductive stages that comprise each reproductive path.
datasets.label: Trial Repro Paths
datasets.name: TP

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TV.STUDYID

datasetVariables.definition: A sequence of characters used by the sponsor to uniquely identify the study.
datasetVariables.label: Study Identifier
datasetVariables.name: STUDYID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TV.DOMAIN

datasetVariables.definition: An abbreviation for a collection of observations, with a topic-specific commonality.
datasetVariables.label: Domain Abbreviation
datasetVariables.name: DOMAIN
datasetVariables.notes: 2-character abbreviation, which must be "TV".

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TV.VISITNUM

datasetVariables.definition: An assigned numeric identifier that aligns to the chronological order of a clinical encounter.
datasetVariables.label: Visit Number
datasetVariables.name: VISITNUM
datasetVariables.notes: Numeric version of VISIT can be used for sorting.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TV.VISIT

datasetVariables.definition: The label for a protocol-defined clinical encounter.
datasetVariables.label: Visit Name
datasetVariables.name: VISIT
datasetVariables.notes: May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TV.VISITDY

datasetVariables.definition: The planned study day of a clinical encounter relative to the sponsor-defined reference start date.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
datasetVariables.name: VISITDY
datasetVariables.notes: Due to its sequential nature can be used for sorting.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TV.ARMCD

datasetVariables.definition: A short sequence of characters that represents the planned arm to which the subject was assigned.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Arm Code
datasetVariables.name: ARMCD
datasetVariables.notes: ARMCD is limited to 20 characters and does not have special character restrictions. If the timing of visits for a trial does not depend on which Arm a subject is in, then ARMCD should be null.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TV.ARM

datasetVariables.definition: The name of the planned arm to which the subject was assigned.
datasetVariables.label: Description of Planned Arm
datasetVariables.name: ARM

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TV.TVSTRL

datasetVariables.label: Visit Start Rule
datasetVariables.name: TVSTRL
datasetVariables.notes: Rule describing when the visit starts, in relation to the sequence of elements.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TV.TVENRL

datasetVariables.label: Visit End Rule
datasetVariables.name: TVENRL
datasetVariables.notes: Rule describing when the visit ends, in relation to the sequence of elements.

datasets.description: A trial design domain that contains the planned order and number of visits in the study within each arm.
datasets.label: Trial Visits
datasets.name: TV

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TD.STUDYID

datasetVariables.definition: A sequence of characters used by the sponsor to uniquely identify the study.
datasetVariables.label: Study Identifier
datasetVariables.name: STUDYID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TD.DOMAIN

datasetVariables.definition: An abbreviation for a collection of observations, with a topic-specific commonality.
datasetVariables.label: Domain Abbreviation
datasetVariables.name: DOMAIN
datasetVariables.notes: 2-character abbreviation, which must be "TD".

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TD.TDORDER

datasetVariables.label: Sequence of Planned Assessment Schedule
datasetVariables.name: TDORDER
datasetVariables.notes: A number given to ensure ordinal sequencing of the planned assessment schedules within a trial.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TD.TDANCVAR

datasetVariables.label: Anchor Variable Name
datasetVariables.name: TDANCVAR
datasetVariables.notes: A reference to the date variable name that provides the start point from which the planned disease assessment schedule is measured. This must be referenced from the ADaM subject-level (ADSL) dataset (e.g., ANCH1DT). \n Note: TDANCVAR is to contain the name of a reference date variable name.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TD.TDSTOFF

datasetVariables.label: Offset from the Anchor
datasetVariables.name: TDSTOFF
datasetVariables.notes: A fixed offset from the date provided by the variable referenced in TDANCVAR. This is used when the timing of planned cycles does not start on the exact day referenced in the variable indicated in TDANCVAR. The value of this variable will be a non-negative duration.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TD.TDTGTPAI

datasetVariables.label: Planned Assessment Interval
datasetVariables.name: TDTGTPAI
datasetVariables.notes: The planned interval between disease assessments.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TD.TDMINPAI

datasetVariables.label: Planned Assessment Interval Minimum
datasetVariables.name: TDMINPAI
datasetVariables.notes: The lower limit of the allowed range for the planned interval between disease assessments.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TD.TDMAXPAI

datasetVariables.label: Planned Assessment Interval Maximum
datasetVariables.name: TDMAXPAI
datasetVariables.notes: The upper limit of the allowed range for the planned interval between disease assessments.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TD.TDNUMRPT

datasetVariables.label: Maximum Number of Actual Assessments
datasetVariables.name: TDNUMRPT
datasetVariables.notes: This variable must represent the maximum number of actual assessments for the analysis that this disease assessment schedule describes. In a trial where the maximum number of assessments is not defined explicitly in the protocol (e.g., assessments occur until death), TDNUMRPT should represent the maximum number of disease assessments that support the efficacy analysis, encountered by any subject across the trial at that point in time.

datasets.description: A trial design domain that provides information on the protocol-specified disease assessment schedule, to be used for comparison with the actual occurrence of the efficacy assessments in order to determine whether there was good compliance with the schedule.
datasets.label: Trial Disease Assessments
datasets.name: TD

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TM.STUDYID

datasetVariables.definition: A sequence of characters used by the sponsor to uniquely identify the study.
datasetVariables.label: Study Identifier
datasetVariables.name: STUDYID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TM.DOMAIN

datasetVariables.definition: An abbreviation for a collection of observations, with a topic-specific commonality.
datasetVariables.label: Domain Abbreviation
datasetVariables.name: DOMAIN
datasetVariables.notes: 2-character abbreviation, which must be "TM".

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TM.MIDSTYPE

datasetVariables.label: Disease Milestone Type
datasetVariables.name: MIDSTYPE
datasetVariables.notes: The type of disease milestone.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TM.TMDEF

datasetVariables.label: Disease Milestone Definition
datasetVariables.name: TMDEF
datasetVariables.notes: Definition of the disease milestone.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TM.TMRPT

datasetVariables.label: Disease Milestone Repetition Indicator
datasetVariables.name: TMRPT
datasetVariables.notes: Indicates whether this is a disease milestone that can occur only once ("N") or one that can occur multiple times ("Y").

datasets.description: A trial design domain that is used to describe disease milestones, which are observations or activities anticipated to occur in the course of the disease under study, and which trigger the collection of data.
datasets.label: Trial Disease Milestones
datasets.name: TM

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TI.STUDYID

datasetVariables.definition: A sequence of characters used by the sponsor to uniquely identify the study.
datasetVariables.label: Study Identifier
datasetVariables.name: STUDYID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TI.DOMAIN

datasetVariables.definition: An abbreviation for a collection of observations, with a topic-specific commonality.
datasetVariables.label: Domain Abbreviation
datasetVariables.name: DOMAIN
datasetVariables.notes: 2-character abbreviation, which must be "TI".

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TI.IETESTCD

datasetVariables.label: Inclusion/Exclusion Criterion Short Name
datasetVariables.name: IETESTCD
datasetVariables.notes: Short name IETEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in IETESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST"). IETESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. The prefix "IE" is used to ensure consistency with the IE domain.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TI.IETEST

datasetVariables.label: Inclusion/Exclusion Criterion
datasetVariables.name: IETEST
datasetVariables.notes: Full text of the inclusion or exclusion criterion. The prefix "IE" (rather than TI) is used to ensure consistency with the IE domain.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TI.IECAT

datasetVariables.label: Inclusion/Exclusion Category
datasetVariables.name: IECAT
datasetVariables.notes: Used for categorization of the inclusion or exclusion criterion. The prefix "IE" (rather than TI) is used to ensure consistency with the IE domain.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TI.IESCAT

datasetVariables.label: Inclusion/Exclusion Subcategory
datasetVariables.name: IESCAT
datasetVariables.notes: A further categorization of the exception criterion. Can be used to distinguish criteria for a substudy or to categorize major or minor exceptions. The prefix "IE" (rather than TI) is used to ensure consistency with the IE domain.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TI.TIRL

datasetVariables.label: Inclusion/Exclusion Criterion Rule
datasetVariables.name: TIRL
datasetVariables.notes: Rule that expresses the criterion in computer-executable form.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TI.TIVERS

datasetVariables.label: Protocol Criteria Versions
datasetVariables.name: TIVERS
datasetVariables.notes: The number of this version of the inclusion/exclusion criteria. May be omitted if there is only 1 version.

datasets.description: A trial design domain that contains one record for each of the inclusion and exclusion criteria for the trial. This domain is not subject oriented.
datasets.label: Trial Inclusion/Exclusion
datasets.name: TI

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TS.STUDYID

datasetVariables.definition: A sequence of characters used by the sponsor to uniquely identify the study.
datasetVariables.label: Study Identifier
datasetVariables.name: STUDYID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TS.DOMAIN

datasetVariables.definition: An abbreviation for a collection of observations, with a topic-specific commonality.
datasetVariables.label: Domain Abbreviation
datasetVariables.name: DOMAIN
datasetVariables.notes: 2-character abbreviation, which must be "TS".

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TS.TSSEQ

datasetVariables.label: Sequence Number
datasetVariables.name: TSSEQ
datasetVariables.notes: Sequence number to ensure uniqueness within the dataset.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TS.TSGRPID

datasetVariables.label: Group ID
datasetVariables.name: TSGRPID
datasetVariables.notes: Used to tie together a group of related records.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TS.TSPARMCD

datasetVariables.label: Trial Summary Parameter Short Name
datasetVariables.name: TSPARMCD
datasetVariables.notes: TSPARMCD (the companion to TSPARM) is limited to 8 characters and does not have special character restrictions. These values should be short for ease of use in programming, but it is not expected that TSPARMCD will need to serve as variable names.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TS.TSPARM

datasetVariables.examples: "Planned Minimum Age of Subjects", "Planned Maximum Age of Subjects"
datasetVariables.label: Trial Summary Parameter
datasetVariables.name: TSPARM
datasetVariables.notes: Term for the trial summary parameter. The value in TSPARM cannot be longer than 40 characters.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TS.TSVAL

datasetVariables.examples: ASTHMA when TSPARM value is "Trial Indications"
datasetVariables.label: Parameter Value
datasetVariables.name: TSVAL
datasetVariables.notes: Value of TSPARM. If TSVAL is null, a value is required for TSVALNF. Text over 200 characters can be added to additional columns TSVAL1-TSVALn.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TS.TSVALNF

datasetVariables.label: Parameter Null Flavor
datasetVariables.name: TSVALNF
datasetVariables.notes: Null flavor for the value of TSVAL describing the reason the value is null, to be populated only if TSVAL is null.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TS.TSVALCD

datasetVariables.label: Parameter Value Code
datasetVariables.name: TSVALCD
datasetVariables.notes: Code of the term in TSVAL from the reference terminology cited in TSVCDREF.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TS.TSVCDREF

datasetVariables.label: Name of the Reference Terminology
datasetVariables.name: TSVCDREF
datasetVariables.notes: The name of the reference terminology or standard format from which TSVALCD is taken.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable TS.TSVCDVER

datasetVariables.label: Version of the Reference Terminology
datasetVariables.name: TSVCDVER
datasetVariables.notes: The version number of the reference terminology cited in TSVCDREF, if applicable.

datasets.description: A trial design domain that contains one record for each trial summary characteristic. This domain is not subject oriented.
datasets.label: Trial Summary
datasets.name: TS

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable AC.STUDYID

datasetVariables.definition: A sequence of characters used by the sponsor to uniquely identify the study.
datasetVariables.label: Study Identifier
datasetVariables.name: STUDYID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable AC.DOMAIN

datasetVariables.definition: An abbreviation for a collection of observations, with a topic-specific commonality.
datasetVariables.label: Domain Abbreviation
datasetVariables.name: DOMAIN
datasetVariables.notes: 2-character abbreviation, which must be "AC".

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable AC.ACSEQ

datasetVariables.label: Sequence Number
datasetVariables.name: ACSEQ
datasetVariables.notes: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness within a dataset. Allows inclusion of multiple records for the same ACPARMCD.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable AC.ACGRPID

datasetVariables.label: Group ID
datasetVariables.name: ACGRPID
datasetVariables.notes: Used to tie together a group of related records.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable AC.ACPARMCD

datasetVariables.label: Challenge Agent Parameter Short Name
datasetVariables.name: ACPARMCD
datasetVariables.notes: ACPARMCD (the companion to ACPARM) is limited to 8 characters and does not have special character restrictions. These values should be short for ease of use in programming, but it is not expected that ACPARMCD will need to serve as variable names.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable AC.ACPARM

datasetVariables.label: Challenge Agent Parameter
datasetVariables.name: ACPARM
datasetVariables.notes: Term for the challenge agent characterization parameter. The value in ACPARM cannot be longer than 40 characters.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable AC.ACVAL

datasetVariables.label: Parameter Value
datasetVariables.name: ACVAL
datasetVariables.notes: Value of ACPARM.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable AC.ACVALU

datasetVariables.label: Parameter Units
datasetVariables.name: ACVALU
datasetVariables.notes: Units for the value in ACVAL, if applicable.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable AC.ACVALNF

datasetVariables.label: Parameter Null Flavor
datasetVariables.name: ACVALNF
datasetVariables.notes: Null flavor for the value of ACPARM, to be populated if and only if ACVAL is null.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable AC.ACVALCD

datasetVariables.label: Parameter Value Code
datasetVariables.name: ACVALCD
datasetVariables.notes: This is the code of the term in ACVAL.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable AC.ACVCDREF

datasetVariables.label: Name of the Reference Terminology
datasetVariables.name: ACVCDREF
datasetVariables.notes: The name of the reference terminology from which ACVALCD is taken.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable AC.ACVCDVER

datasetVariables.label: Version of the Reference Terminology
datasetVariables.name: ACVCDVER
datasetVariables.notes: The version number of the reference terminology cited in ACVCDREF, if applicable.

datasets.description: A special purpose domain for the characterization of challenge agents (i.e., the substances administered to cause the diseases or conditions of interest) for those study designs that involve the use of a challenge agent.
datasets.label: Challenge Agent Characterization
datasets.name: AC

description: This SDTM class describes the plan for the procedures to be followed in a clinical trial, including planned and actual timing of events, control group, method of allocating treatments, blinding methods, assignment of epochs that subjects pass through in the course of a trial. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, TRIAL DESIGN, 2021-09-24)
label: Trial Design
name: Trial Design
